_exec_summary.SummaryText: 1). The Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:  The Airgas East, Inc facility located in Billerica, Massachusetts complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP Gas Storage and NFPA-55 requirements for the storage of chlorine cylinders. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws. If an emergency accidental release were to occur iinvolving either  propane or chlorine storage/handling systems, it is our policy to immediately notify the Billerica Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency. We also have our own emergency response team, which is supplied with the most current response equipment on the market. Each member of the emergency response team attends training and is re-qualified annually. In addition, all employees are trained annually in HAZCOM procedures and Process Safety Management (PSM). 2). A description of the facility and the regulated sustances handled: The Airgas East, Inc Billerica facility stores propane in one 18,000 gallon above ground storage tank. Propane is put into storage cylinders of various sizes, and associated piping, valves, and other micellaneous equipment. The Billerica facility also stores Chlorine cylinders. The chlorine storage/handling process consists of 18,000 pounds of chlorine stored in cylinders. The cylinders are stored in secured containment on site. The cylinders are moved into containment and later moved out of containment and shipped off site. No chlorine filling or material transfer is done on site. 3). The general accident release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps: The Airgas East, Inc Billerica facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state, and local codes and regulations. The propane system has been designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA 58 and State law. The chlorine system complies with the requirements of NFPA 55 and State law. The chlorine storage is in

secured containment an is away from property lines and protected from vehicle traffic. 4). Five year accident history: The Airgas East, Inc Billerica facility has never had an accident involving its propane storage/handling process. 5). The emergency response program: In the event of an emergency accidental release involving either propane or chlorine storage/handling systems, it is Airgas East's policy to immediately notify the Billerica Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency. The Airgas East emergency response team would also be notified. All employees have access to the Airgas East emergency action plan. Emergency action training is conducted annually. 6). Planned changes to improve safety: None.
